newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Portman in new China iron ore contract.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Portman in new China iron ore contract.

text.p: Portman Mining Ltd said on Monday it has secured a five-year contract to supply three million tonnes of high grade lump iron ore over the nexct five years to Chinese steelmills, starting next January.
Portman said the iron ore would come from the Koolyanobbing iron ore joint venture project in Western Australia.
The new contract had resulted from an 18-month marketing and trialing programme, Portman said.
"This positive acceptance of the lump ore gives us confidence that we can secure further long terms sales contract," Portman said.
All fines ore produced from Koolyanobbing is under sales contract to Angang Australia, Portman's 40 percent joint venture partner in the Koolyanobbing project, Portman said.
"The outlook for the project and the iron ore market globally are encouraging, and places are being made to increase production in 1997," it said.
The Koolyanobbing iron ore project is expected to sell a total of 1.5 million tonnes of product for the 1996 year.
